instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..
definitions.U5000: What is U5000? This is the System Management Controller(SMC) in macbooks from 2013-2015.

threads.title: Liquid-damaged <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> (Air 2017) with updating issues
threads.message:
I'm trying to revive an old <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board with liquid damage. I replaced several corroded components around <CHIP>U1950</CHIP>, <CHIP>U5000</CHIP>, <CHIP>U7701</CHIP>, and <CHIP>U6100</CHIP>, including the SMC, backlight driver, and EFI chip. Now this machine is running nicely and passes Apple Hardware Test. But whenever I try to update the OS, the machine restarts to begin updating, then stalls - the fan spins up and stops, spins up and stops, and so on. Only unplugging the battery makes the board start up again (and the update is not applied).

Any idea why the machine works fine except during OS updates?

threads.title: Liquid-damaged <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> (Air 2017) with updating issues
Liquid-damaged <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> (Air 2017) with updating issues
threads.message: Yes, and I flashed it with a clean ME region file.

threads.title: Liquid-damaged <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> (Air 2017) with updating issues
threads.message: I tried various OS updates and noticed that the system possibly hangs during Boot ROM (EFI firmware) updates. What components are required for the logic board to write to <CHIP>U6100</CHIP>?

threads.title: Liquid-damaged <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> (Air 2017) with updating issues
threads.message:
Check <TRANSISTOR>Q1920</TRANSISTOR> and its related resistors/traces.

You can also update macOS in other machine and put back the SSD.

threads.title: Liquid-damaged <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> (Air 2017) with updating issues
threads.message:
Couldn't find anything wrong in the <TRANSISTOR>Q1920</TRANSISTOR> neighborhood.

Yes, I could update the SSD but the Boot ROM would be stuck on an ancient version from 2017. And no further updates could ever be run.

threads.title: Liquid-damaged <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> (Air 2017) with updating issues
threads.message: Try to flash the SMC, with MuertoGB's tool from github (SMCTool).

threads.title: Liquid-damaged <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> (Air 2017) with updating issues
threads.message: Ok, I reflashed the SMC using the <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> file with SMCTool. No change. There must be a hardware issue.

threads.title: Liquid-damaged <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> (Air 2017) with updating issues
threads.message: Change <CHIP>U6110</CHIP>; check the board pads and traces first.

threads.title: Liquid-damaged <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> (Air 2017) with updating issues
threads.message: Tried that and no change. I think it's time to call it quits for this board.
